post content: b"I am feeling so very low. Can't accurately describe in words how bad I feel. It feels though that it is my fate to die. Soon. It feels inevitable now."
b"I'm sorry you feel so bad at the moment, WaverunnerPlease stick around and stay with us, and don't go through matters alone. Post here.Sending you a hug "

b'Hi WaverunnerSorry that you feel this way. Can i ask what kind of support are you getting? Is there anyone close to you that you can turn to. Also when you say that it your fate to die do you mean that you are feeling suicidal? sorry if thats a bit of a blunt question just trying to understand what you mean.'
b'I know that feeling. Try and hold on as best you can because it probably wont last. Keep talking to us here and if the thoughts become worse then please got yourself to hospital xx'
b'So good to see you back!!  so sorry that its under such sad circumstances. Much love to you xx'

b"I'm so sorry you're feeling like this. I know it might seem inevitable - that's part of the nature of illness that is depression - but it's not inevitable. Things can start to look up (I know it's hard to see that right now). You're worth far more than you realise right now. Try not to focus on the future, because your illness will only allow you to see bleakness right now; try to focus on the moment instead, and try to fill your day with little moments that are as enjoyable as possible. Thinking of you. We're here for you."

b'Currently going through an assessment for psychotherapy and waiting to see what I will be offered. Also due to have a few sessions with a psychologist in relation to my physical health. Not really any support outside of that. And yes, I do feel suicidal.'
b"I'm sorry to see your struggling too I hope you can keep yourself safe. Thinking of you  xx"

b"In a similar boat, as so many of seem to be. No magic answer im afraid. You're going through the hardest of times, but it won't last. It can't. You'll either start to see hope or do as you're suggesting and exit. Even though I dont know you and will never meet you, I hope the former is the case. You have worth as do we all. Somewhere, sometime you will cause someone to smile, and somewhere someone will make you smile. Just do your best to keep going until then"
b'So sorry to hear it, Waverunner. I truly hope you keep holding on and keep yourself safe. '

b"When I am desperate and very suicidal, and there is no help (which usually there isn't), I try to persuade myself to put it off. I tell myself I can do it if I have to, but I can wait one day more.That bit of time can help sometimes."
b'Hi waverunner, thinking of you xxx'

b'Hope mate, please have hope, because when you feel so low and lost, there is someone out there who would be devastated if you chose to leave. Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars...when the daylight breaks through...and it will, you will so appreciate life and have more to give as you have been to the depths...stay strong bro.'

b"It's everyone's fate to die no point speeding it along. Life is hard, and the down's seem to last forever. All you can do is survive those times.....somehow. You gotta believe good times follow bad times and if you stay in the game things will turn around."
b"If you ever want to speak to someone about the physical side I'm here for you  I hope the professionals can help you get well soon "
b"Thank you all for your replies. I'm not feeling up to writing more now but just wanted to say thanks to all. Wish I could feel hope..."

b"So, had what was supposed to be the final appointment for my psychotherapy assessment today. Think perhaps should not have been so honest about how I'm feeling. Anyway, still don't know the outcome as she thinks that I'm so low that the crisis team should be involved. She also feels I should be on medication (which I again refused). So, she wants some time to speak to cmht etc etc and offered me 1 more appointment after she's had those discussions. I've also had a letter from the Recovery Team with an appointment in July. I don't really have any interest in engaging with the cmht and I'm not sure if I'll be offered the therapy. So, not much left is there?"

b"I'm glad that you were honest with her about how you're feeling, because at least then they can put in place some support for you if you choose to take it. I'm sorry you feel that medication wouldn't really work, and that you seem to be overwhelmed by yet more appointments with your therapist - but surely it's good that you're on their radar?"
b'The problem is that they think they know how to "support" me. They don\'t listen when I have asked for things so not sure what would be different now.'

b"Thanks Dissatisfied. I have previously posted about what I felt would work/ not work for me and why. I won't repeat it here other than to say I have asked for individual psychotherapy and I am yet to get an answer. That is all I want at this point. It is their anxieties driving all the rest and their anxieties are not my worry. All I'm looking for is a yes or now so I can make my own decisions."

b'Was not having a go at you Dissatisfied. The difference between you and my workers is that you are making suggestions based on what you have read here and with more limited info. I do appreciate the suggestions.'

b"Don't think I'm expressing myself very well at the moment. Feeling pretty apprehensive about what will come out of the psychotherapy assessment and the discussions she has with the cmht. Feeling a bit scared."

b"Thanks. I don't think that anyone understands my refusal of medication and it worries me that this will be seen as me being uncooperative and that I'll be forced into it. I'm also not so good at being assertive in these situations. Guess I'll see what happens in the next few days as I wouldn't be surprised if the cmht contact me sooner rather than later."
b"I'm not quite sure which scares me more - them leaving me alone vs not leaving me alone. It's a no win situation. "

b"Hi waverunner, it's nice to see you again but I'm sorry things aren't good at the moment. I identify with what you've said about medication, it's very difficult when you feel you are a lone voice against a consensus. I've been persuaded many times into medication I didn't want to take and didn't believe would help (it didn't in my case). You've a right to your opinion on what you think will help, and if that's talking treatment rather than drugs they shouldn't view this as being uncooperative (they shouldn't, but unfortunately might). They can't force medication on you unless you're sectioned and admitted ( or I suppose they could force you by refusing other help unless you take them). But I hope you can manage to keep asserting what you feel is best for you, I wish you strength to be able to do that. And you do come across as strong and resilient to me, even if you perhaps don't feel it at the moment, you are contending with one of the hardest things anyone can face, and admitting to your feelings which takes courage and strength."

b"Alice, thank you for your words. Have found it hard to be on here in the past few weeks as I don't really want to drag anyone down and not really felt able to support others. I also realise that I am feeling negative about things at present but that doesn't mean I don't know what will not work for me. At this point, I feel pretty numb. Just had enough and not wanting to do this anymore. I don't care if I die but I absolutely do not want to end up being sectioned or forced into something I don't want only because it alleviates the anxiety felt by professionals. Death is preferable to that."
b'Feeling restless and agitated. Not so sure what to do with myself. Dark thoughts, strong urges.'

b'I had a bout of that last Thursday night, no easy answers to give, I was drinking and luckily passed out. I had the same feeling again Saturday afternoon and took myself out of the house to paint a door for a property I look after ( im a self employed gardener, sometimes painter!)Can you take yourself out for a walk, just to clear your thoughts a bit ?'

b"I really, really agree with this - if your mental health professionals aren't listening to your needs, then unfortunately you need to fight your corner.So sorry you're struggling with this. It'd be so much easier if they'd listened to you in the first fucking place."

b"Please don't be concerned about dragging people down, your need for a place to talk and express feelings is what's important right now. People can choose to read or not read, and to an extent people know it comes with the territory that it won't be all roses the things people want to talk about here. You've as much right as everyone else to talk about difficult times and difficult feelings. Sorry you are feeling so numb and have had enough. Please keep talking. I hope the professionals hear you as well. Hugs to you "
b"Thanks again Alice. Just have trouble believing that I'm deserving... still struggling with negative thoughts and urges. Don't want to be here."
b'Feel so alone '
b"Aw hun, we're here. Keep talking."
b" can't sleep"
b"Aww, you really do deserve care and support though, I know what you mean though, I know that feeling. You're not alone, people are here who understand and care "
b" wish I could say I felt it. It struck me the other day how alone I am and I don't want to be alone anymore. Not sure why I'm struggling to go on, need to let go. "

b"There was a quote about friends on someone else's thread at the beginning of the week, can't remember the thread or the poster but if anyone remembers it, please can you let me know where to find it."

b"UmmIt could be one of thesehttp://www.mentalhealthforum.net/forum/thread108839 from 2 days agohttp://www.mentalhealthforum.net/forum/thread108760from 3 days agohttp://www.mentalhealthforum.net/for...ead108735.html from 4 days agoCan't find anything else from this week at the moment.xxx"

b"Thanks, no it wasn't any of these. I copied the quote on Monday but there was an issue with the formatting so can't decipher it now. It was part of a long thread. I thought it was a really good quote and wanted to keep it. Thanks for looking! Appreciate it!"
b"Now I'm on a mission lol"
b'You made me smile which is hard to do at the mo! Thanks though! Wish I could remember but part of it is about a friend coming into your life and staying.'
b'If it was a famous quote it might be here??Friendship Quotes - BrainyQuote'
b"I don't think it is this one but maybe.http://www.mentalhealthforum.net/forum/thread50962.htmlDo you remember anyone who commented on it?"
b"Wasn't that one. I though it may have been Kerome but I may also be making it up. Tried searching that but didn't find it."
b"Haven't find it in here but some of these are very good so thanks."
b'(((waverunner))) Thinking of you, love Alice x'
b'Nothing to say, just trying to stay connected. So badly want to crawl into a hole and disappear.'

b"Hi, I feel similarly, don't think we've spoken before, just to say hi and keep trying to connect. The urge to disappear is hard to resist I know, but very hard to achieve. Be kind as you can to you xx"
b"Hi Catkin. Thank you. It is hard to resist the urge to disappear but I don't think it's impossible to achieve. The fact is, no one would miss me. I hope that you are ok."

b'I know it feels as if no one would miss you, but I think we can comfort ourselves with that thought. You would be missed, I don\'t doubt that.I won\'t say too much about it but I\'ve worked with people who\'ve tried and failed to "disappear", die. It isn\'t easy. But living isn\'t either is it? I\'ve read some of this thread now, you are waiting to hear about therapy?Can you wait until you find out what support is offered and give that a good go first, see where you are up to then? Being at the point of having nothing to lose can feel desperate, but sometimes also liberating. Sorry if I\'ve spoken out of turn. X'

b"You haven't spoken out of turn Catkin. I appreciate your words. I am trying to hold on to hear about the therapy. I do have a suspicion though that being offered therapy will be conditional of me engaging with the cmht which I'm not really keen on. I just wish they would say one way or another so that I know where I stand. The question is whether I can hang on or whether I want to at this point."

b"Yes, it is hard waiting to hear. I don't know, but if you do start therapy, the cmht could simply be there in the background, as you will be focussing on therapy. Do you know what the cmht want you to do in terms of engaging?If the person or people you've seen from cmht so far are affecting your reluctance to have them involved, you can ask to see someone else? X"

b'I hope you are feeling okay today WR My CC is getting me some sort of councilling talking therapy for after shes closed with me and ive not been with her long nor do I see her often.... It may be worth engaging and pkaying along just to get the therapy in place, atleast it may be faster that way. Xx'

b'Thanks Catkin and Wildflower. I think it may come to me "playing the game". However, a bit concerned because the therapist doing the psychotherapy assessment thinks I need much more involvement from them, including the crisis team which I don\'t want. She also made a throwaway comment about me considering how long I can continue to do my job. Didn\'t get a chance to discuss that further unfortunately but it was a bit of a shock as work has always been a safety net for me despite being stressful. Never taken time off for MH reasons either so not sure where this came from. Not feeling any better but decided being as honest as I was is perhaps not a good thing. My mind is all over the place though.'

b"But if you are actively suicidal ? they can't ignore that fact, and if this is the case, then surely there is nothing to lose. Work doesn't exist if you are dead, therapy won't help then, but if you need some support to enable you to access therapy, isn't it worth seeing if you can work with services to get to the therapy that you want? It is your decision re work unless you are signed off, but it would be wrong for the assessor not to voice their concerns. X"

b"I wanted to remain working too as I found it distracted me but when I was miserable around services users I knew I couldn't give them what they needed anymore... Sometimes it is important to concentrate on yourself. You dont have to accept extra support... I only saw crisis when I needed meds, they just phoned me to check I was ok instead. Then I was handed to my care coordinator who I only saw once a week now twice so they really dont intrude that much if you seem well "

b"What you say is true. I am so used to having to do things on my own (I know it's not a great way to operate). I also haven't felt I've been supported by the cmht when I was willing to engage so I'm apprehensive on this occasion. Re work - although I haven't had time off for MH reasons, I have just gone back to work after a year off as I have cancer. And for all sorts of reasons, don't want more time off. I guess I will need to see what happens and then make a decision."

b"I agree with you about being miserable around service users and if I felt that I wasn't able to meet their needs, my decision may be different. At the moment I can separate things and function at work but I hear you. Re cmht, maybe I'm overthinking things. Won't know until the therapist communicates her thoughts further with me. I can talk myself into opposing views within a short period . I don't know, I give up."
b'Have you been talking to the Samaritans too? They help me.'
b"Hi Healing. No, haven't used the Samaritans. I have an anxiety about using the phone. I know I could email I text but can't bring myself to do that either. Also have massive issues with trust."

b"You can email Samaritans  although its quite slow, I hate telephone talking too so emailed but found it not much help. I think as support we imagine to be cared for as we would our su's and that hasn't happened in my experience and it saddens me. I guess I need to help myself more but I'm struggling too thats why I'm under them? I duno... I look well therefore I must be ok. I'm glad you can still be strong enough to separate work and personal life  "
b"You are so right! Don't think I would still be here if I didn't have work."
b'Thinking of you wave runner'

b'Had an appointment with psychologist today (not the same as the person doing the assessment) and this relates only to my physical health. It was a good appointment though and feeling marginally better this afternoon.'

b"Work helps you? How do you put these thoughts aside to work? I'm going to have to do it and so scared.I have issues with trust too. I email samaritans from my old email address with no name identifyer."

b"I'm not really sure how I do it. Part of it is about bracketing which is literally like putting my stuff in a box until I can come back to it. And keeping busy so I don't have time to stop and think about me. I'm not always successful though but I manage"

b"I'm sorry that you have cancer, a lot to deal with. Glad that you had a good appt with a psychologist today. If you can explain to assessing therapist or cmht what helped you today might it help you to push for therapy and show that you are benefitting from that psychologists input, not needing crisis team etc? Can't make sense but hope you can understand what I mean.sorry x"

b"Thanks Catkin. You make sense. The assessor was aware of my appointment today and I think that's the only reason that nothing else has happened yet. She asked me if I thought that the psychologist appointment would hold me and I said I thought it would. I think she also heard that I find weekly sessions (actually don't necessarily have to be weekly) helpful as a way of containing the thoughts/ urges. My sessions with the psychologist are time limited though and there is a long waiting list for therapy (if offered). Anyway, I think the psychologist will write to my GP who is quite supportive so will see what comes from that. I see the assessor again next week though so we'll see what happens."
b"Well, that didn't last long. Time to go."
b"I don't know what you mean? Do you mean how you feel has changed?I'm sorry xx I need to shut down now but will think of you and hope you can keep safe xx"
b"Sending you much love and I hope you can stay safe. I've been a bit crap at keeping up with the depression forum and so i'm sorry i've not seen this thread until now.. xx"
b'Still feeling very on edge and my mind is a jumble of feelings. Low.'
b"Sorry to hear it. Please try your best to keep holding on. Don't give up on yourself. "
b"Don't feel I have a purpose for being on this earth "

b"Sometimes it isn't about having a purpose. Sometimes we are the purpose. Maybe it is time for you to look after yourself so that in the future you will be able to look after others and have a purpose. This is your time now so be kind to yourself. Get yourself better. Sad x"

b'Feel like I\'m going in circles but spinning so fast I can\'t get off this "ride". More than ever I don\'t want to be here. My anxiety is also on the increase as I have my appointment re the psychotherapy assessment this week. I\'m a little scared of what the outcome may be and of being forced to engage with the cmht. I feel I might be ambushed at this appointment so just want to cut and run or worse.'

b"Hello buddy  nothing won't happen to you because your going to overcome this and win. I know you can do this. Also keep engaged on this forum, we will be there for you and support you. Never give up! I won't let you "
b' how much longer can I hold on?'
b'Hi WaverunnerYou can hold on. I know it is hard. I go through a similar struggle. Many people on here care for you and are willing you to get through this. Xxxx'
b"Thank you SarahD. Don't think I believe that people (here or anywhere) care. "

b"I don't know your personal circumstances, whether you have friends or family, but I can tell you that people on here do care. If you read through just this one thread you can see that people do care and feel for you and want to help if they can. People here have had similar problems and understand what it is like, so when they offer support it is from the heart.Are you feeling worse because you are worrying about the assessment?"
b"Oh we do. I know I don't know you in real life or anything, but I genuinely want you to be safe and happy. We do care. You've got us to talk to; please remember that. "

b"I just wanted to pop in to say I care too - i've not been on the forum much this weekend, but intend on doing a proper catch-up when the film i'm watching ends.I'm really sorry things are feeling worse and worse for you.I can understand that you'd be nervous about the psychotherapy assessment, but it could lead to some brilliant support and turn out to be one of the best things you've done.. you never know. "

b"Thanks all. I'm feeling more anxious because of the psychotherapy assessment appointment but generally feeling pretty low as I have for some time. I do want the therapy badly as I genuinely think it will help but after my last appointment (which was supposed to be the last), I'm concerned that they may not even offer the therapy or if they do, it will be conditional of my engagement with the cmht which I don't want. However, think she is concerned about the risk. I'm felt this way for such a long time so I don't see the risk in the way she does and no one has really been bothered before. It feels more like their own anxieties and covering their backs then genuine care and concern."

b"Hi WaverunnerSorry I haven't had the chance to get back to you before. What day is the assessment? What kind of engagement with the CMHT are you worried about?It is funny, but there is a kind of parallel going on with me at the moment. I am soon to start some therapy (although it is a short course) which I think could help me, and I am desperate, but I am at odds with the CRT and think I may be about to sabotage everything. Again.I think the only thing you can do is try, see what is offered. You may as well do that. It could be really good. (Keep telling myself that. Still nearly messed everything up this week.)I am thinking of you. Xxx"

b"Thanks SarahD. The appointment is Friday. The assessment was supposed to be complete but she was so concerned about me after the last appointment that she wanted time to consider things and also talk to the cmht. She felt that the crisis team should be involved and she wants me seen by a Pdoc. I currently have an appointment in July (as a result of her referring me after our first appointment) which I had planned on cancelling anyway. I don't want any involvement with cmht, just the therapy. I have generally stayed under the radar of cmht but the couple of experiences I have had haven't left me feeling very optimistic. THe most recent being my cpn not turning up for an appointment and not following up until my GP contacted her at which point she blamed me for getting the arrangements for the appointment wrong (I know I didn't). Additionally, I had asked her specifically to use my mobile to contact me as a live in a shared house with no confidentiality. She didn't respect this and it put me in a difficult position. And left me feeling pretty angry. I get your feeling of sabotage because at this point I'm fighting the strongest urge not to walk away from everything (I know what it means for me if I do walk away so holding on by a thread). I hope that things work out for you! "

b"Relationships with mental health service are so tricky aren't they? If you are back in touch you should tell them you only have one phone number now and get them to delete the other one. I can see why you don't want to be involved too much with them. I have had good and bad experiences with them, very wary of them, sure they don't tell me what is really going on, it unsettles me. I don't like the way they do things.The only thing is, it is probably worth hanging on to see about the therapy, and you must really stress to them you want to do it, that you think it could be valuable and make a difference. It has to be worth a try.As I said, I am in an awkward situation with them and feel let down, and also fighting the urge to do something which will just be self-destructive. But I am going to try not to!I hope you can hold on and try too."

b"Thanks SarahD. Yep, very tricky. I'm pretty much trying to get to Friday to see what happens. No promises though. I hope that you manage to get through it! Unfortunately, I've had no good experiences with them."

b"I've just realised that I'm pushing people away (not that there are many to push away). Such an internal battle going on at the moment. Wish I could feel solid ground under my feet instead I feel I'm in the middle of a stormy sea with no way to help myself. Will soon be on my own in the flat so much easier to act on urges."
b'We are still here for you, even if you are alone in the flat. I hope you can hold on. Xxx'
b"I don't want to hold on."
b'please hold on xx you are a very special person xx sending all my love xx'
b"I know you don't want to hold on. I also know how that feels. Please try.We do really care what happens to you."
b'Not looking forward to the day, feeling lousy '
b'Morning Waverunner. Sorry you feel so bad. Can you go out for a while? It is a beautiful morning here.'
b'Thanks SarahD. Was at work and turned into a busy day. Still feeling lousy and pretty drained '

b"Hey wave, I'm so sorry you are feeling this way - what a wonderful person you must be to post encouraging and supportive messages to others, when you feel like this yourself x It's a hard slog isn't it, but we don't know what's around the corner - cling to that thought wave - good things could be around the corner x"

b"I wouldn't say that about myself but thanks for your kind words! We don't know what's around the corner, you are right but just wish I felt a whole lot closer to that corner. Really just want it to end now."

b"I know exactly how you feel wave, labourious isn't the word! Try and take care of yourself - have a bath, listen to some music, write a letter, put on some nice smellies, eat chocolate, light a candle - anything to give yourself a break for half an hour x"
b'I made a promise to someone to give them the opportunity to say goodbye. Not sure I can keep that promise.'
b'Come on wave - please hang in there x'
b'How you doing wave?'
b'Wavey let us know you are ok when you can?Xxx'
b"I don't know you but reading this has made me cry, I really really hope you're alright x"
b'Wave, please let us know your alright x'
b'I hope you are safe and that this pain ends soon. It always does end. It may go on a long time but it does get better.'
b'Still here. Not okay. Sorry my post made you cry In the Clouds.'
b"I haven't been online much today, but have been thinking about you. Xxxx"

b"It is hard to do anything when you feel this way. It's like suffocation and paralysis for me. I retreat into my shell and inside there is no air. Food can't get in. Nothing can get in. Well, little bit of something get in. Inside my shell I have photographs of good times. Memories of being loved and cuddled by grandparents. I peek out and see people and the world and let some in. I'm usually scared to look for too long otherwise I risk bad stuff coming in to my shell. I just thought some kind of description and words might help you. Expression is a good way to allow yourself to breathe. Shutting down is what you might be doing and that is ok but when you start to awake you must come straight here to talk because you will need people to rationalise your thoughts and tell you that you will be ok. We have been there."
b"Hang in there wave, and try your best to keep us updated, there's been some very worried souls around here x"

b'Thanks everyone. I think tomorrow will be make or break for me. Last (should be) appointment with therapist doing assessment. Should hear what the outcome of her discussions with cmht have been and if I will be offered therapy. I feel that the last thread holding me may be cut tomorrow (if I get there). So so tired.'

b"Well, really try your best to make that appointment, might just be the lift you need? Are you under the crisis team? I know they've such a bad name, and I personally have nothing good to say about them, but when your in despair like this, they are the only people you can turn to - they can keep a check on you, which it seems you need right now x"

b"I feel similar. Hanging by a thread which the strength of is determined by a future event. Yours tomorrow and mine in one week. I wish mine was tomorrow to get it over and done with.We cannot however give such power to others. Whatever they do or decide, we are in our own hands. I'm depressed and tired too. I am the one who has to struggle through and help myself. If others are there to help then that is a bonus. Luck. We cannot rely on that help sometimes though. I'm cynical about the help out there though. I have been let down. I hope you won't be let down."

b"I don't want cmht or crisis team involvement. Therapist thinks I should be under crisis team - we disagree so tomorrow will know what they have decided. I feel it's inevitable now though because I don't think I'll like what tomorrow will bring. I just want the therapy, nothing else and won't be manipulated into anything else."
b'Talk to them and see.'
b"Thanks Sad. Think I'm done but that's ok."

b"Please talk to someone,It really does help,To be able to talk to someone,Who doesn't know ant if your family, and friends,Really helps,Because your not being judged.I still find it hard to express how i feel to my family,And how i really feel, about things.i still hide a lot of who i really am.there has been many very dark times,Self harm,Self hatedred,Trying to block out thoughts, and feeling,Angry at everyone and everything,Days where nothing would go right,Even nearly trying to commit suicide,But i managed to get through,I still get days like this,but there not as bad,And i try to think, or do things that make me laugh,Even if other people don't think so!"

b"We don't get to choose when we die. I was told this is a test which will make us wise. Not much comfort is it. I don't have the answers I just am in your boat. We are all on this boat together. If one of us jumps overboard, it's not right, it cannot happen deliberate or accidentally. And accidents happen a lot.Here's a life jacket. Stay with us."

b"Had my appointment today. She kept me waiting and I was just about at the point of leaving when she came to get me. Not a good start and I was in a really bad place when I got there and not really able to talk. She did contact the cmht and I think she was surprised when I said they hadn't contacted me. She checked the notes and said they were still deciding what to do. She also started to go down the road of saying she wanted more discussions with them. I was clear that I didn't want their involvement and I think she finally heard this but I'm still not convinced they won't contact me. The good news is they are going to offer me individual therapy (although there is a waiting list of about 6 months from this point) and I feel relieved but I still want to give up. I think this confused her a little and I understand why. I can't explain it other than to say I've been hanging on by a thread for so long that I don't feel I can anymore. She is still concerned about the risk and wants to see me again in 3 weeks. Also managed to talk with her about the comment she made about me continuing to work. I understand her reasoning now although I felt for a bit that she thought I might be exaggerating things to her. I think I was able to explain this to her. So, guess I got what I wanted and should be happy but feeling so detached from everything now and just want to end the pain. On my own at home now for a while so could easily achieve this. Thank you to all who have responded to my posts and supported me."

b"I'm glad you have offered therapy  I also understand the emotions you are going through, assessments are hard as they are but when you have a added complication like the worry of CMHT it is awful.Please stay safe HunXxx"

b"Thanks MarlieeBee. It's good to see you on the forum! I'm not sure I can stay safe at present, don't trust myself very much. Also struggling physically right now with symptoms so had blood tests today and waiting for results - more anxiety and the pain doesn't help my mood any."
b'If I have to stay safe then we can do this together xxx'

b"It's hard when there are breaks in therapy and you don't have them to talk to. And nearly a month is a long time when sessions are usually weekly. Can you remind yourself that even when they're away, they haven't forgotten you, and they're still holding your needs and your distress in mind? They still care about you, even when they're not available to talk to. And they will keep their 'promise' to return, they are not abandoning you to cope alone. Are there things they've said that have helped that you could write down, that would help you stay safe, and help you maintain hope? Maybe you could write down each week the things you would raise in therapy if they were there, so you can still get out the things that are on your mind and can use them on their return, or maybe putting them in an email, even knowing you wouldn't get a reply. This might all give you a feeling of continuity and connection to the work you are doing.As regards the letter to your GP, is it the idea of ringing up that is daunting? I think it's unlikely the GP's would contact you with an appointment on the basis of the letter, but at least they'd not need the whole situation explaining if you went to see them. When my therapist wrote a letter like this explaining she was going to be away and I might want support from them, I was able to book a GP's appointment which felt in some small way that I was still connected to someone who was concerned about me and my welfare, even though they didn't have the skills my therapist does to help me. And it was evidence of my therapist's continuing care and 'holding me in mind' to make this contact with the GP. Could you perhaps send a copy of the letter if you have one by post to the GP with a note asking for an appointment, if asking in person or on the phone is difficult? You deserve help and acknowledgment that you are struggling, your need is legitimate, your GP should and most likely will understand that breaks in therapy can be a risky and difficult time. Mine did (even if not fully), and wanted to help, and it was somewhat helpful to have someone to touch base with in my therapist's absence, even though it wasn't in any way a replacement therapy session. I still felt alone without my regular therapy sessions, but it helped a little. And it is still a part of your therapist's care for you that they have put this contingency in place.I'm glad you've touched base with the forum where people who care can also offer support and advice. This shows you are acknowledging your own needs, and that you deserve to be heard, and that you want to make it through this difficult time and out the other side. And you will, even though it's painful and so lonely.Sending warm thoughts to you Wave, I am willing you on. Big hugs x"

b'Spoiler alert: We\'re all going to die. It\'s the ONLY thing resembling "destiny" that we have. I don\'t subscribe to the idea that there is anything or anyone out there that will give us meaning. The Universe does not care about us, any more than a cardboard box might.My little sister just died on June 30, and my little brother is going to die later this year, thanks to Hepatitis B and C. Mom joked that my inheritance just tripled, but we\'re really working to deal with this.I\'ve had my bouts, where I wonder about the point, or why bother when it\'s all meaningless. I\'ve rambled about it all before, so I\'ll try to refrain.The meaning of life is the meaning that you apply to it. If you want to make a difference, then you can volunteer. Go study a field where you might be able to improve the lives of others.If it\'s truly meaningless to you, then at least do something for yourself. Take a shower. Play video games. Write something on the forum. Basically, I just described my morning.As for the "point" of life, I think that the point of life is like the point of a needle. It\'s very small and focused, and it matters only to you. Your happiness, sadness, pain, joy, excitement... all of it is yours. You are the star of your own movie, just as everyone else is theirs. You may have no idea how many times you were a background player in someone else\'s story, but it could be into the millions.Maybe nobody cares about you, or very few might. That\'s nothing special. We give no thought to the 50,000 babies who die every single day from diarrhea due to unclean drinking water. And I\'m sure they don\'t think about us one bit, either. None of you knows me, so the likelihood of you caring in a way that would impact me would be most small.I figure that I\'m in a pretty good place, relatively speaking. Sure, I could do myself in and be done with it. But the time that I have here is so relatively short. I\'m not suffering from End Stage Renal Failure or a cancer of any kind. The time is short, and maybe pointless, so why not do something for me?Certainly, you deserve that for you. F**k the world, and any concept of meaning! YOU are here RIGHT NOW, and you can do something for you. Let go of what you believe SHOULD be, accept what is, and then you are free to move about and experience something.At the very least, Waverunner, you owe yourself some decent experiences. You owe yourself some help. You\'re harming yourself because the physical pain distracts you from the emotional pain. It\'s also why people drink too much, eat too much, do lots of drugs, binge-watch television, and so on.I have a painful past, so I understand. Maybe not as bad, but it\'s not a contest. My little sister is dead, and my little brother is dying, because they were running from the pain. Instead of running or trying to cover it up, I decided to soak in it. I recognize that the times I was harmed are gone, as are the people who caused the harm, even if they didn\'t know their neglect counted as harm.I refuse to give those past events and people more power by allowing them to f**k up my day today.So I\'m going to do my best to rise above and do something for myself. Some days it\'s easy. Other days, it\'s damned near impossible, and I might binge-sleep all day. It happens, although more rarely than in the past. Those who say, "It gets better," are liars. IT never gets better. YOU get better at dealing with IT.And sometimes we need some professional help to guide us outside of ourselves so that we can effective deal with IT and then put IT in its proper place.When people tell me to "cheer up," I often feel compelled to punch them in the face. I don\'t, of course. But that sentiment never works. Getting help works. Talking about it works. Coping with it works.Self-harm, booze, drugs, and other things are only band-aid solutions that fall off the first time they get wet.I hope that you can find it within yourself to at least seek out some external help in the form of a professional, because like everyone else, YOU deserve a decent day.I might live another 20 years, or I might live another 20 minutes. Nobody knows.'
